intro: Alcea apterocarpa var. lilacina, commonly known as the lilac-flowered hollyhock, is a variant of the hollyhock plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its tall, sturdy stems and large, showy flowers that range in color from pale pink to deep lilac. The leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, giving them a soft, velvety texture. This variety is typically cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes. It prefers full sun and well-drained soil, and it is relatively drought-tolerant once established.
